reviews.text:
This house is located between Joan Miro Park and Gran Via de les Corts Catalanes. 

The house was completed in 1929 and is an example of Catalan Modernism. 

There is a mosaic butterfly crowning the house.
Well worth seeking it out as something not every visitor to Barcelona has seen. It’s very close to the Joan Miro Park and Las Arenys shopping centre. One of the more hidden sights of Barcelona

The fantastic metropolis, Barcelona, has many beautiful and interesting buildings.
Casa Fajol is one of them.
It is named after Salvio Fajol, who owned the building.
Casa Fajol is situated on Carrer de Llanca 20, close to Parc de Joan Mirò.
The building, which is about 100 years old, was built by the modernist architect  Josep Graner.
Casa Fajol is also called Casa de la Papellona (Butterfly House), because of the big butterfly on the top of the facade.
Today it is difficult to see the butterfly, because a big tree in front of the house in the narrow street.
